title: Authors and Citation
text: Xu C (2022). ryx: Calculate Correlation outcome varaible group independent variables, respectively. R package version 1.0.0.0000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ryx: Calculate Correlation between an outcome varaible and a group of independent variables, respectively},   author = {Christina Xu},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 1.0.0.0000}, }

what: Calculate Correlation between an outcome varaible and a group of independent variables, respectively
title: Calculate Correlation between an outcome varaible and a group of independent variables, respectively
text: package deals correlation among variables. ryx calculates correlations one outcome variable group independent variables, respectively, well significance correlations.

title: Calculate Correlation between an outcome varaible and a group of independent variables, respectively
text: CRAN development version

title: Calculate Correlation between an outcome varaible and a group of independent variables, respectively
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(ryx)  library(MASS) x <- ryx(Boston, y="medv")  print(x) summary(x) plot(x)

title: Boston Dataset — Boston
text: data frame reporting housing values suburbs Boston.

title: Boston Dataset — Boston
Boston Dataset — Boston
text: data frame 506 rows 14 columns crim numeric. Per capita crime rate town. zn numeric. Proportion residential land zoned lots 25,000 sq.ft. indus numeric. Proportion non-retail business acres per town. chas integer. Charles River dummy variable (=1 tract bounds river; 0 otherwise). nox numeric. Nitrogen oxides concentration (parts per 10 million). rm numeric. Average number rooms per dwelling. age numeric. Proportion owner-occupied units built prior 1940. dis numeric. Weighted mean distances five Boston employment centers. rad integer. Index accessibility radial highways. tax numeric. full-value property-tax rate per $10,000. ptratio numeric. pupil-teacher ratio town. black numeric. 1000(Bk - 0.63)^2 Bk proportion blacks town lstat numeric. Lower status population (percent) medv numeric. Median value owner-occupied homes $1000s
